com.ashtonit.odb.pool

Interface OrientGraphPool

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    OrientGraphPoolImpl

    public interface OrientGraphPool
    An OrientGraphPool instance maintains a pool of OrientGraph instances. A call to get(String, String, String) with url, username and password returns one to the caller. The caller releases the instance back to the pool by calling shutdown() on the OrientGraph instance with no arguments.

    Requires Java 1.7 or above.

    Author:
    Bruce Ashton

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      com.tinkerpop.blueprints.impls.orient.OrientGraph get(String url, String username, String password)
      Return an OrientGraph instance initialised with the given URI, username and password.
      void removeAll(String uri, String username)
      Remove all OrientGraph instances from the pool that match the given URI and username.
      void shutdown()
      Shut down the database instance.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        com.tinkerpop.blueprints.impls.orient.OrientGraph get(String url,
                                                      String username,
                                                      String password)
                                               throws OrientGraphPoolException
        Return an OrientGraph instance initialised with the given URI, username and password.
        Parameters:
        url - an OrientDB database URI
        username - an OrientDB database username
        password - the password to match the username
        Returns:
        an OrientGraph instance
        Throws:
        OrientGraphPoolException - if no OrientGraph instance is available

      • removeAll

        void removeAll(String uri,
               String username)
        Remove all OrientGraph instances from the pool that match the given URI and username. Call this method when a user logs out of an application.
        Parameters:
        uri - an OrientDB database URI
        username - an OrientDB database username

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Shut down the database instance. Actually just releases this instance back into the pool.
